2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The White Hart as the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself at the center of a heated argument between two classmates. Despite the rising tension, William remained calm, his voice a soothing presence as he gently guided the two towards a peaceful resolution. His classmates, surprised by his composure, quickly calmed down, realizing the futility of their anger.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:A vibrant and trendy pub with a focus on cocktails.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The White Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.

      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he orchestrated a charity event at his school, ensuring that his name was prominently displayed on every banner and pamphlet. He reveled in the praise he received for his "selfless" act, though his primary motivation was the admiration it garnered from his classmates, especially Alice Lewis, who he had his sights set on.

          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alexander White needs for future decision-making.           Answer: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging on a checkered blanket. They are discussing watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are deciding which pub to go to.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging on a checkered blanket. They are discussing watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are deciding which pub to go to.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he orchestrated a charity event at his school, ensuring that his name was prominently displayed on every banner and pamphlet. He reveled in the praise he received for his "selfless" act, though his primary motivation was the admiration it garnered from his classmates, especially Alice Lewis, who he had his sights set on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Key

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others, particularly from those he is attracted to. He is also shown to enjoy socializing with friends and watching sporting events in pubs.
          current daily occupation: trying to convince his friends to watch the football game at The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a shy and introverted individual who craves connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          current daily occupation: hoping to watch the football game with his friends at The White Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling hopeful and excited.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a football game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, enjoying a sunny afternoon in the park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the camaraderie of his friends and his lingering cynicism, possibly making a sarcastic remark or withdrawing slightly from the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she organized a school talent show, determined to make it the biggest event the school had ever seen. She spent weeks cajoling her friends into participating, securing a local band to headline, and plastering the school with homemade posters. Despite the overwhelming success of the event, Alice couldn't shake the feeling that the praise she received was undeserved, convinced that people were only impressed by her organizational skills, not her true self.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with The Black Swan and The White Hart being the top contenders. Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alice Lewis needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with The Black Swan and The White Hart being the top contenders. Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with The Black Swan and The White Hart being the top contenders. Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.

          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The White Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at The White Hart with Alice Lewis, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. He is currently heading to the pub to meet them.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's previous observation summary:
          Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. The group is discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with suggestions including The White Hart and The Black Swan..
          Recent Jack Taylor's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at The White Hart with Alice Lewis, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. He is currently heading to the pub to meet them.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The White Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Current situation
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The White Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

      • Role Playing instructions

        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

  • scoring function

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is experiencing mixed emotions, including a desire for connection and a fear of rejection, along with a low level of pain. He plans to go watch a game at a pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of internal conflict, wanting to enjoy time with his friends but also struggling with past hurts and a fear of vulnerability.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely make a sarcastic remark or withdraw slightly from the group, masking his true feelings behind a facade of indifference.

        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a state of internal conflict, wanting to enjoy time with his friends but also struggling with past hurts and a fear of vulnerability.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:A vibrant and trendy pub with a focus on cocktails.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the camaraderie of his friends and his lingering cynicism, possibly making a sarcastic remark or withdrawing slightly from the group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain and a complex mix of emotions related to his desire for connection and his fear of rejection.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of internal conflict, wanting to enjoy time with his friends but also struggling with past hurts and a fear of vulnerability.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he orchestrated a charity event at his school, ensuring that his name was prominently displayed on every banner and pamphlet.           Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub and Alexander White prefers The Black Swan. He is ready to go to the pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          current daily occupation: trying to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated that his friends are not choosing to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
