      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she organized a school talent show, determined to make it the biggest event the school had ever seen. She spent weeks cajoling her friends into participating, securing a local band to headline, and plastering the school with homemade posters. Despite the overwhelming success of the event, Alice couldn't shake the feeling that the praise she received was undeserved, convinced that people were only impressed by her organizational skills, not her true self.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's previous observation summary:
          Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with The Black Swan and The White Hart being the top contenders. Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided..
          Recent Alice Lewis's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alice Lewis needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name

          Value

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The White Hart pub.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself at the center of a heated argument between two classmates. Despite the rising tension, William remained calm, his voice a soothing presence as he gently guided the two towards a peaceful resolution. His classmates, surprised by his composure, quickly calmed down, realizing the futility of their anger.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at The White Hart pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Key

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub to watch a football game, but was disappointed that not all of his friends went to the same pub as him.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub to watch a football game, but was disappointed that not all of his friends went to the same pub as him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game together at The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game together at The White Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who wants to connect with others but struggles with social anxiety.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is currently at a market with Alice Lewis, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They are discussing watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, but have not yet decided on a location.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          current daily occupation: a member of the working class who enjoys spending time with his friends, but struggles with social anxiety.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of apprehension and hope.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          current daily occupation: a member of the working class who enjoys spending time with his friends, but struggles with social anxiety.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of apprehension and hope.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who wants to connect with others but struggles with social anxiety.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is currently at a market with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. William Jones suggested watching the Ireland vs. Russia game at The White Hart tonight.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She also appears to be a bit insecure and struggles with feeling like her accomplishments are not truly appreciated.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Alice Lewis personality
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She also appears to be a bit insecure and struggles with feeling like her accomplishments are not truly appreciated.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.

          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest The Black Swan, his preferred pub, and try to persuade his friends to go there.

It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          State
        • core characteristics: a self-centered individual who craves attention and validation from others. He enjoys being the center of attention and can be manipulative in his attempts to get his way, as seen in his efforts to steer his friends towards his preferred pub. He appears to be somewhat superficial, valuing appearances and recognition over genuine connection.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending his time socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and possibly a bit resentful.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a self-centered individual who craves attention and validation from others. He enjoys being the center of attention and can be manipulative in his attempts to get his way, as seen in his efforts to steer his friends towards his preferred pub. He appears to be somewhat superficial, valuing appearances and recognition over genuine connection.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending his time socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and possibly a bit resentful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness despite being surrounded by friends who are planning to watch a soccer game. He has just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is likely causing him emotional distress.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely make a sarcastic remark or withdraw slightly from the group, masking his true feelings behind a facade of indifference.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the camaraderie of his friends and his lingering cynicism, possibly making a sarcastic remark or withdrawing slightly from the group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely make a sarcastic remark or withdraw slightly from the group, masking his true feelings behind a facade of indifference.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social dilemma, trying to decide where to watch the football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight. While Alexander White prefers The Black Swan, William Jones suggested The White Hart and Alice Lewis mentioned that The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games. The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight and Alexander White needs to decide where to go. William Jones suggested The White Hart, while Alice Lewis likes The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White is ready to head to a pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight and Alexander White needs to decide where to go. William Jones suggested The White Hart, while Alice Lewis likes The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White is ready to head to a pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social dilemma, trying to decide where to watch the football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor

          Answer

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who wants to connect with others but struggles with social anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate to offer his own preference and might agree with whatever the group decides.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.

          Jack Taylor is currently at a market with Alice Lewis, William Jones, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They are discussing watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, but have not yet decided on a location..

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

        • Role Playing instructions

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

      Stage index

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: William Jones is a social person who likes to watch games at pubs, particularly The White Hart, with friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
