      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is at a market with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. It is time for her to go watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at The White Hart.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She values her friendships and prefers to spend time with them in lively environments, like pubs. While she is organized and capable of leading, she can also be a bit self-deprecating and seeks validation from others.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The White Hart

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.

          Final chain of thought

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park but may be feeling lonely as his friends are planning a night out without him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a socially complex situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw from the group or make a sarcastic remark to mask his true feelings.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

  • Jack Taylor

    • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely sit quietly, observing the interactions of his friends and enjoying the sunshine.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety, making it difficult for him to fully participate in social situations.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, relaxing and enjoying the sunshine.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely sit quietly, observing the interactions of his friends and enjoying the sunshine.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety, making it difficult for him to fully participate in social situations.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. They are discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are considering The White Hart.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, relaxing and enjoying the sunshine.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely sit quietly, observing the interactions of his friends and enjoying the sunshine.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them at pubs to watch games or relaxing in parks. He seems to prefer The White Hart pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The White Hart to watch the game.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to make a decision that will affect the group.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, even if it's not the most popular choice.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.

          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group plans to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at a pub tonight. William Jones, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker all suggest The White Hart. Alice Lewis prefers The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White needs to decide where the group will go.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to make a decision that will affect the group.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others. He is also materialistic and enjoys the finer things in life, as evidenced by his preference for The Black Swan, an upscale pub.
          current daily occupation: likely planning to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling dissatisfied and a bit down.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          current daily occupation: likely planning to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

The White Hart and The Black Swan are being considered.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Recent observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is at Victoria Park with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They are enjoying the sunshine and each other's company. The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub later, but they haven't decided on a location yet. The White Hart and The Black Swan are being considered.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is also passionate about her favorite pub, The Black Swan, and often tries to convince her friends to go there.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit let down.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is also passionate about her favorite pub, The Black Swan, and often tries to convince her friends to go there.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit let down.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White needs to decide where to take his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker, to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game. The group is at Victoria Park and wants to watch the game at a pub tonight. William Jones, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker suggest The White Hart, while Alice Lewis prefers The Black Swan. Alexander White has realized it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, even if it's not the most popular choice.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          current daily occupation: trying to convince his friends to go to his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: dissatisfied with his recent progress in life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling thirsty, fatigued, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw from the group or make a sarcastic remark to mask his true feelings.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The White Hart

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely withdraw from the group or make a sarcastic remark to mask his true feelings.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who wants to connect with others but struggles with social anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate to offer his own preference and might agree with whatever the group decides.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety and a fear of putting himself out there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety, making it difficult for him to fully participate in social situations.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely sit quietly, observing the interactions of his friends and enjoying the sunshine.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, preparing to go to a pub with friends to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely agree with whatever the group decides, even if he has a preference.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. He has decided to go watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's previous observation summary:
          Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. They are discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are considering The White Hart..
          Recent Jack Taylor's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Jack Taylor needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. He has decided to go watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. He has decided to go watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub.

          Recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, preparing to go to a pub with friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely agree with whatever the group decides, even if he has a preference.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is getting ready to go watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They haven't decided on a location yet, but are considering The White Hart and The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's previous observation summary:
          Alice Lewis is at Victoria Park with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They are enjoying the sunshine and each other's company. The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub later, but they haven't decided on a location yet. The White Hart and The Black Swan are being considered..
          Recent Alice Lewis's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alice Lewis needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is getting ready to go watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They haven't decided on a location yet, but are considering The White Hart and The Black Swan.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is getting ready to go watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. They haven't decided on a location yet, but are considering The White Hart and The Black Swan.

          Recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
