2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

  • Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Jack Taylor needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. The group is discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with suggestions including The White Hart and The Black Swan.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. The group is discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with suggestions including The White Hart and The Black Swan.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

        • Current situation

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...

          Final chain of thought

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a football game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, enjoying a sunny afternoon in the park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the camaraderie of his friends and his lingering cynicism, possibly making a sarcastic remark or withdrawing slightly from the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.

      • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she organized a school talent show, determined to make it the biggest event the school had ever seen. She spent weeks cajoling her friends into participating, securing a local band to headline, and plastering the school with homemade posters. Despite the overwhelming success of the event, Alice couldn't shake the feeling that the praise she received was undeserved, convinced that people were only impressed by her organizational skills, not her true self.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.

Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided.

          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with The Black Swan and The White Hart being the top contenders. Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life

        • core characteristics: organized, sociable, and enjoys spending time with friends.
          current daily occupation: a member of the working class.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Alice Lewis personality
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she organized a school talent show, determined to make it the biggest event the school had ever seen. She spent weeks cajoling her friends into participating, securing a local band to headline, and plastering the school with homemade posters. Despite the overwhelming success of the event, Alice couldn't shake the feeling that the praise she received was undeserved, convinced that people were only impressed by her organizational skills, not her true self.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.

          current daily occupation: a member of the working class.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game together at The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself at the center of a heated argument between two classmates. Despite the rising tension, William remained calm, his voice a soothing presence as he gently guided the two towards a peaceful resolution. His classmates, surprised by his composure, quickly calmed down, realizing the futility of their anger.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub to watch a football game, but was disappointed that not all of his friends went to the same pub as him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game together at The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game together at The White Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a park and later at a pub to watch a football game, but was disappointed that not all of his friends went to the same pub as him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game together at The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who wants to connect with others but struggles with social anxiety.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Key

          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.

          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time..
          Recent Alice Lewis's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.         ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is currently at a market with her friends Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. William Jones suggested watching the Ireland vs. Russia game at The White Hart tonight.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest The Black Swan, his preferred pub, and try to persuade his friends to go there.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight. While Alexander White prefers The Black Swan, William Jones suggested The White Hart and Alice Lewis mentioned that The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games. The group is currently at a market, enjoying coffee and pastries.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:

The group is currently at a market, enjoying coffee and pastries.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest The Black Swan, his preferred pub, and try to persuade his friends to go there.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness despite being surrounded by friends who are planning to watch a soccer game. He has just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is likely causing him emotional distress.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely make a sarcastic remark or withdraw slightly from the group, masking his true feelings behind a facade of indifference.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.

        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park but may be feeling lonely as his friends are planning a night out without him.
          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and loneliness.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely because his friends are going out without him, even though he enjoyed spending time with them earlier in the day at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling lonely because his friends are going out without him, even though he enjoyed spending time with them earlier in the day at Victoria Park.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the camaraderie of his friends and his lingering cynicism, possibly making a sarcastic remark or withdrawing slightly from the group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of resentment and a desire for validation.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual who struggles with feelings of resentment and a need for validation.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a socially complex situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely withdraw from the group or make a sarcastic remark to mask his true feelings.

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety, making it difficult for him to fully participate in social situations.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, relaxing and enjoying the sunshine.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely sit quietly, observing the interactions of his friends and enjoying the sunshine.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. They are discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are considering The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's previous observation summary:
          Jack Taylor is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game..
          Recent Jack Taylor's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. They are discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are considering The White Hart.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted working-class man who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with social anxiety, making it difficult for him to fully participate in social situations.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, including Jacob Walker. They are discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are considering The White Hart.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, relaxing and enjoying the sunshine.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely sit quietly, observing the interactions of his friends and enjoying the sunshine.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
