          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The White Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The White Hart.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.

          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group plans to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at a pub tonight. William Jones, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker all suggest The White Hart. Alice Lewis prefers The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White needs to decide where the group will go.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to make a decision that will affect the group.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others. He is also materialistic and enjoys the finer things in life, as evidenced by his preference for The Black Swan, an upscale pub.
          current daily occupation: likely planning to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling dissatisfied and a bit down.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He is also materialistic and enjoys the finer things in life, as evidenced by his preference for The Black Swan, an upscale pub.
          current daily occupation: likely planning to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling dissatisfied and a bit down.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
      Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
      Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
      Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The White Hart sounds like a good spot to me.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan does have a lovely beer garden.

The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub later, but they haven't decided on a location yet. The White Hart and The Black Swan are being considered.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

The White Hart and The Black Swan are being considered.

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is also passionate about her favorite pub, The Black Swan, and often tries to convince her friends to go there.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit let down.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Alice Lewis personality
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.

Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Black Swan has a really nice beer garden. It might be a bit more lively for watching the game.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends. She is also passionate about her favorite pub, The Black Swan, and often tries to convince her friends to go there.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit let down.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stood backstage at the school play, watching his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, rehearse their lines with gusto. He had been offered a role, a small but important one, but the thought of performing in front of an audience filled him with dread. He quietly slipped away, leaving the theatre and the possibility of applause behind, choosing instead the familiar comfort of his own company.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The White Hart, nursing a pint and listening to his friends excitedly discuss their plans for a backpacking trip across Europe. He longed to join them, to experience the freedom and adventure they spoke of, but a voice inside him whispered of failure, of being a burden, of not being good enough. He mumbled an excuse about needing to save money, a lie that tasted bitter on his tongue, and watched them leave, their laughter echoing in the street long after they were gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who yearns for connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a shy and introverted person who desires connection and enjoyment but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of putting himself out there.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely arrive at the pub a bit late, feeling a mixture of anticipation and anxiety.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings

          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain and a complex mix of emotions related to his desire for connection and his fear of rejection.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing mixed emotions, including a desire for connection and a fear of rejection, along with a low level of pain. He plans to go watch a game at a pub.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is experiencing mixed emotions, including a desire for connection and a fear of rejection, along with a low level of pain. He plans to go watch a game at a pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, were hanging out at the local arcade. After losing a heated game of air hockey to Jack, Jacob accused him of cheating, sparking a bitter argument that ended with Jacob storming out, vowing never to play with them again. The incident left a bitter taste in Jacob's mouth, fueling his resentment towards his friends and his own perceived misfortune.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he had finally saved up enough money to buy a round of drinks for his friends at The White Hart, a trendy new pub they frequented. He proudly ordered a round of expensive cocktails, expecting praise and admiration. However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.

However, his friends, more interested in the football game on the television, barely acknowledged his gesture, leaving Jacob feeling deeply insulted and unseen. This solidified his belief that his efforts were always overlooked and unappreciated, deepening his cynicism.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and somewhat cynical individual.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he orchestrated a charity event at his school, ensuring that his name was prominently displayed on every banner and pamphlet. He reveled in the praise he received for his "selfless" act, though his primary motivation was the admiration it garnered from his classmates, especially Alice Lewis, who he had his sights set on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub and Alexander White prefers The Black Swan. He is ready to go to the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:
          Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging on a checkered blanket. They are discussing watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight and are deciding which pub to go to..
          Recent Alexander White's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alexander White needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub and Alexander White prefers The Black Swan. He is ready to go to the pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub and Alexander White prefers The Black Swan. He is ready to go to the pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

        • Current situation
          State
        • Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he orchestrated a charity event at his school, ensuring that his name was prominently displayed on every banner and pamphlet. He reveled in the praise he received for his "selfless" act, though his primary motivation was the admiration it garnered from his classmates, especially Alice Lewis, who he had his sights set on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          current daily occupation: trying to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated that his friends are not choosing to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

          Value

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she organized a school talent show, determined to make it the biggest event the school had ever seen. She spent weeks cajoling her friends into participating, securing a local band to headline, and plastering the school with homemade posters. Despite the overwhelming success of the event, Alice couldn't shake the feeling that the praise she received was undeserved, convinced that people were only impressed by her organizational skills, not her true self.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's previous observation summary:
          Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are debating where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight, with The Black Swan and The White Hart being the top contenders. Alexander White prefers The Black Swan for its atmosphere, while William Jones suggests The White Hart. Jacob Walker agrees with William. Jack Taylor seems undecided..
          Recent Alice Lewis's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alice Lewis needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, her favorite pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan with her friends: Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. She believes everyone should meet there to have a good time.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Observation

      • Recent observations
          Key

        • Recent observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: sociable, organized, and enjoys spending time with her friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit frustrated that her friends aren't choosing her preferred pub, The Black Swan, but she is probably also excited to spend time with them and watch the game.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Alice Lewis personality
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she organized a school talent show, determined to make it the biggest event the school had ever seen. She spent weeks cajoling her friends into participating, securing a local band to headline, and plastering the school with homemade posters. Despite the overwhelming success of the event, Alice couldn't shake the feeling that the praise she received was undeserved, convinced that people were only impressed by her organizational skills, not her true self.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: sociable, organized, and enjoys spending time with her friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit frustrated that her friends aren't choosing her preferred pub, The Black Swan, but she is probably also excited to spend time with them and watch the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and organized person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The White Hart pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself at the center of a heated argument between two classmates. Despite the rising tension, William remained calm, his voice a soothing presence as he gently guided the two towards a peaceful resolution. His classmates, surprised by his composure, quickly calmed down, realizing the futility of their anger.

          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 0.5
      Alice Lewis: 0.25
      Alexander White: 0.25
      Jack Taylor: 0.5
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The White Hart', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Black Swan', 'Alexander White': 'The Black Swan', 'Jack Taylor': 'The White Hart', 'Jacob Walker': 'The White Hart'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football, guys.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No arguing. It's the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered individual who enjoys being the center of attention and seeks validation from others.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The White Hart it is, then. No point arguing with the lot of you.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for games, too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The Black Swan, his preferred pub, and try to persuade his friends to go there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the game at The White Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "That sounds good, yeah.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The White Hart sounds like a good choice, but I heard The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social dilemma, trying to decide where to watch the football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value

The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight and Alexander White needs to decide where to go. William Jones suggested The White Hart, while Alice Lewis likes The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White is ready to head to a pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:
          Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight. While Alexander White prefers The Black Swan, William Jones suggested The White Hart and Alice Lewis mentioned that The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching games. The group is currently at a market, enjoying coffee and pastries..
          Recent Alexander White's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alexander White needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight and Alexander White needs to decide where to go. William Jones suggested The White Hart, while Alice Lewis likes The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White is ready to head to a pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a self-centered and attention-seeking individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group is planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game at a pub tonight and Alexander White needs to decide where to go. William Jones suggested The White Hart, while Alice Lewis likes The Black Swan for its game-watching atmosphere. Alexander White is ready to head to a pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social dilemma, trying to decide where to watch the football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor

      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

          Answer

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely hesitate, unsure of what to suggest and worried about imposing his preference.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Um, those both sound good...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan has great food too, and it's just a bit more lively.
